Make Binary Data

Source: R/data.R
make_binary_data.Rd

Make Binary Data

Usage

make_binary_data(marginals, rho, obs = 1000)

Arguments

marginals

a K-sized vector of marginal probabilities

rho

a correlation matrix

obs

number of rows in the dataset

Value

a matrix of simulated observations

Examples

K <- 8
marginals <- rbeta(K, 2, 3)
rho <- rlkjcorr(1, K, eta = 1 / 4)
out <- make_binary_data(marginals, rho)
head(out)
#>   k1 k2 k3 k4 k5 k6 k7 k8
#> 1  1  1  0  0  0  1  0  0
#> 2  0  0  0  0  1  1  0  1
#> 3  0  1  0  0  0  1  0  1
#> 4  0  0  0  1  1  0  0  0
#> 5  0  0  0  1  1  0  0  0
#> 6  1  0  0  0  1  0  0  0
colMeans(out)
#>    k1    k2    k3    k4    k5    k6    k7    k8 
#> 0.109 0.465 0.031 0.388 0.541 0.736 0.056 0.355 
marginals
#> [1] 0.11944329 0.46556715 0.02627365 0.39860397 0.56347394 0.70392211 0.06967656
#> [8] 0.33971610
